header (“Location: http://www.frugooscape.net/smf”);
exit;
} else {
header (“Location: http://www.frugooscape.net/smf/warn.php”);
exit;
}

item.source: I need help with making a warning on my site

item.title: I need help with making a warning on my site
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

Hi,
You know the moparscape warning when you access the forums, well I’m trying to make my own.
Bottom line i made it. The problem is when i log in to my forums the message pops back up.
I use cookies to do it.

Code in my index.php file (http://frugooscape.net/smf/):

if(isset($_COOKIE['forumWarn'])){ //setcookie("forumWarn", "nothing", time()+31536000); }else{ $URL="http://www.frugooscape.net/smf/warn.php"; header ("Location: $URL"); }

It just checks if there is a cookie. If not it sends it to the ur.

Code in my warn.php file:

if($agree == "yes"){ setcookie("forumWarn", "nothing", time()+31536000); $URL="http://www.frugooscape.net/smf"; header ("Location: $URL"); }
Thats the important code that does it all.

Now why when i log into smf it ignores the cookies?

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with making a warning on my site
